website_summaries.verdict: An excellent replacement frame for platform and daybeds, this super-strong queen slat frame provides extra support for foam beds that other models don't have.
pros: Able to use with any bed frame, even one not designed specifically for slats
just slides in with no need to attach with screws
Non-slip tape keeps mattress from moving around
Provides great support without sagging or squeaking
cons: Bunkie board — not a full bed frame — without legs and feet
Some users feel it’s a bit shorter than other queen frames

customer_reviews.title: Way too small for my Queen size bed
customer_reviews.text: I’m soooooooo disappointed it’s way to small for my bed and it will not fit in my car for me to return it. I did read all of the negative reviews about the board being too small for Queen size beds but I wanted to take a Chance. So now I’m stuck with a frame that is too small and no where to sleep until I figure out this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Roz

customer_reviews.title: I don't need to climb on the bed anymore.
customer_reviews.text: The first time I received this product a piece was broken, so I had to return it to be exchanged. Repackaging and returning it was not an easy job. That's why I'm giving it 4 stars. The second time was a charm. It is easy to install and seems to hold the heavy and thick mattress well. Getting rid of the box spring made the bed look much better. I have a very tall mattress and the box spring made the bed look like a mountain. Now it is a regular size bed to which no one needs to climb. Even the room looks bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Aylin O.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: We had called 'Zinus" with a question about this bunkie board, left a voice mail, they never responded. So, we took a chance and ordered the queen size Zinus Easy Assembly Quick Lock Bunkie board anyway, hoping the product would be better than their customer service. It arrived very quickly, is exactly as described and pictured in illustration, and was extremely easy to assemble. My husband had it done, all by himself, in less than a half-hour. It fits inside our poster bed perfectly (a problem with another brand's box-spring-look foundation) because of the rounded corners on the Zinus product. Yayyy!!! We are very happy with this and would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Alexmom

customer_reviews.title: Engineered quality
customer_reviews.text: My husband usually despairs over the quality and craftsmanship that is lacking in most products today, but he was over the moon for this bunkie board. The packaging, instructions and clear labeling of parts was excellent. It included a nice tool for easy assembly What astonished him as that someone had evidently given the item so much forethought . He was the extremely impressed by the precision of the engineering and how beautifully the various parts fit together. The finish is excellent as well. We had no issues with the mattress sliding away from the board, perhaps because of the sticky tape included for that purpose. He actually asked me to give a great review - Well Done!
customer_reviews.author: Gabby M

customer_reviews.title: Too small!
customer_reviews.text: It says it fits most queen beds, I disagree. My bed frame is a pretty standard and this thing was about an inch too small in both length and width to sit on the side rails. Be sure to measure the area that this is supposed to rest upon before ordering and compare it to the dimensions listed in the description. If I had to guess, it’ll also be too small for you.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Slats may be too short for the bunkie board!
customer_reviews.text: When I first opened and started assembling this item, I thought it seemed great. The ratchet allen wrench is awesome! However, after getting the entire board put together, which was very easy and straight-forward... the slats are literally too short to reach across the board they came with. It's impossible to bend the board inward to force them to meet, so...this thing is 100% useless. Good luck returning this huge piece of trash! No refund until it's shipped back, which is impossible after it's built.
customer_reviews.author: Carly Bob

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with Malm queen sized bed frame from Ikea.
customer_reviews.text: The metal slat system is not the standard 60" wide for a queen; it is less. I have an Ikea Malm bedframe (which is actually slightly wider than 60") and the slats were just short enough in width that it caused the slats to slip off one side of the bed frame if weight/force was applied to one side of bed. I went to Home Depot and bought 2 lengths of wooden shims 3/8" thick to fit the gaps on both sides between the slats and the bed frame. This prevents the slats from moving too much to one side but the slats still managed to slip off the frame.
customer_reviews.author: mahja

customer_reviews.title: Did not work with ZInus Upholsted Button Tufted Premium Bed at all
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this thinking it would just fit right in my queen Zinus bed, you know, since they're the same brand. And come to find out it doesn't fit at all. Once assembled, it sits on top of my bed frame and does not work as intended. After contacting Zinus through both email and phone (no response by email), I was simply told to return it and get a refund. Really disappointed their products don't all work together. It'd be nice if they listed the bed frames that this doesn't fit or perhaps manufacture a bunkie board that fits in their different sized frames.
customer_reviews.author: machupichu

customer_reviews.title: Need a non slip pad, but otherwise perfect
customer_reviews.text: This paired with a grippy mattress pad (I got the Gorilla grip) is the perfect combination. 4 stars because on a regular metal bed frame - this slat board sits down in the rails - with no additional room for the mattress to sit in - leaving no stopper for the mattress to slide right off. I also have a Zinus foam mattress that is very light, and the force of just sitting on the side of the bed would push the mattress off the other side (I am around 130 lbs). I replace my existing boxspring with this metal slat frame because it made the bed too high.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: shortfall
customer_reviews.text: placed atop my iron bedframe wood slats that I was too lazy to remove - worked out well - *almost* - width not exactly queen size and Bunkie Board does not completely fit in bed frame - had to use Styrofoam pieces to fill in the 3 inch shortfall to prevent Bunkie Board from sliding around- good thing I left the wooden slats on - should the wood slats give up will have to look for a traditional metal bed frame and get box springs - only the bed wood slats is holding up the Bunkie Board, not the platform bed side recessed support bars - tossed the very damaged shipping carton so now stuck with this purchase. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Myost Pitts

customer_reviews.title: Great product but Damaged package
customer_reviews.text: Update: extremely easy to put together, very sturdy and perfect size. Love the stay in place strips the matress doesn't move an inch. Updated the stars after realizing the delivery should not impact the manufacturer and the product rating. A few dings isn't bad cause we can't even see it. First review: The package was delivered unbelievably damaged. Which, I'm assuming, is what caused for the zip ties holding the pcs together to snap in the box. Also chips in the bars. Will update review after I move with how sturdy and easy to put together this is. 2 stars for how damaged this came.
customer_reviews.author: LoveLife

customer_reviews.title: I can roll over without my bed falling
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this thing. I hate that I just found it. I've been having issues with my wooden boards falling out from under my bed for a few years (I especially loved when it would happen at 2 am when I rolled over and half my mattress would go down effectively making me roll onto the floor). This thing is amazing, it was super easy to put together, maybe 10 minutes, they even included a little Allen wrench rachet that I plan on keeping and using for other things (it's super cute btw). Love love love this. It fit perfect on my queen bed, and I'm literally so happy I can roll over I might marry this thing.
customer_reviews.author: clarence  c pellerin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit.
customer_reviews.text: It was perfect. Easy to assemble. Pick up and place it over the existing wood slates. It’s so sturdy. My bed doesn’t squeak and more and it’s lower. My old box spring was 7 inches thick and my mattress alone is 15 inches. It was so tall and uncomfortable. Not it’s perfect. I did read reviews of it not fitting correctly. I immediately went to my bed and measured it. I thought it wasn’t going to fit. But my ex boyfriend had it backwards. Don’t invite your ex to help you build it. I could have done it myself. Minus moving the mattress, old box spring, and putting this one on.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Garces

customer_reviews.title: Did Not Fit My Queen Size Bed
customer_reviews.text: This Bunkie board / Bed Slat Platform was too small for my queen size bed. Upon initial installation of it we rigged the corrugated cardboard to prevent any slippage. It worked for a month and then today the whole thing collapsed. We had to go to Home Depot to get 5 boards which measured 60 3/4" whereas the bunkie board came in short at 59 1/2". My mistake if Queen size is not a standard width, but according to Google Queen size is 60" which would have worked.
customer_reviews.author: Suzette Hay

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: Too small by an inch in every dimension. Zinus, please google dimensions for a Queen size bed. You’re doing it wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: You gotta do some trimming down to fit but now it works!
customer_reviews.text: After trimming off the ends of the side rails and cutting them to fit the bed, I think its going to work just fine. Of course the middle brace has to but cut off a couple of inches and welded so it can be screwed to the top and bottom rails, but all in all its okay. I tried several sets of railings before I gave up and decided to cut the frame down to fit the bed. After cutting the ends off, I had to drill new holes so the frame could be screwed together. A little bit of work to keep from sending it back and waiting for a replacement, but it's worth it in the end.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda C

customer_reviews.title: Great Replacement for Wooden Slats
customer_reviews.text: I was having a lot of problems with the wooden slats on my platform bed. The wooden legs in the center kept falling and my mattress started to sag, therefore, I had to do something. I was considering getting rid of my bed. Well, thank God I found this steel Zinus bunkie board/bed slat replacement! It was easy & quick to assemble and everything needed was in the box. My bed is nice and sturdy, not to mention quiet now! It doesn't squeak when we turn over or anything. This is one of the best purchases I've ever made! If you're sick of the problems that come along with wooden slats, this is what you need!!! It is amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Queen-B

customer_reviews.title: Traditional foundation not needed.
customer_reviews.text: I love my mattress and it was stacked on top of a foundation, your typical foundation. Of course you get talked into buying one of those because if you don’t purchase it with the mattress, you void the warranty. Just another way to get you buy something you really don’t need. I will never buy a foundation again. I am a short person and my mattress and foundation and the frame it was on, I needed a ladder to get into bed. I replaced my foundation with this unit and it’s perfect. Mattress still feels the same. Nice and comfortable but lower to the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Murray

customer_reviews.title: totally useless product. the minimum this width needs to be ...
customer_reviews.text: totally useless product. the minimum this width needs to be to work is 60.5". the width on this product is slightly less than 60'. it'll work only if your bed frame lip is wider than the usual tufted bed frames out there oif which most are made in china...hmmm. im just going to go to the lumber yard and have them cut me reliable quality wood slats. done.
customer_reviews.author: Ataturk

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to lower my mother's bed by replacing the box springs on her queen bed. It worked perfectly. It's important to note that this is a replacement for box springs, not a bed frame - your frame that supports your existing mattress is still necessary. Beyond that, it went together easily using the supplied wrench. My mom loves it and it makes it easier for her to get into bed and seems to be a perfectly good alternative to box springs; she says the bed sleeps great - maybe better than before. Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: S. Powell

customer_reviews.title: Hooray!  My husband and I can sleep.
customer_reviews.text: Hooray! We purchased a bed this year that had wooden planks that were supposed to support the mattress, but they flexed and made us feel like we were sleeping on an old saggy bed. We put this into the bed and now we have great support and can actually not wind up piled on top of one another in the middle of the bed. We get along so much better when we've been able to sleep through the night. Go figure!!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly T.

customer_reviews.title: Easy Setup and Very Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: We needed this in a hurry when we realized that our Mattress purchase was mistakenly ordered #1 without a box spring, and if we purchased a normal box spring our already thick 14" mattress would be over 19" tall. This worked mainly because of its height, and its cost. It checked all of our boxes, and fit the bill! One tip: It comes with tape to hold the mattress in place. USE IT Your mattress WILL move if you do not use the tape, or something that will hold it in place. That is the only criticism that I have, and its so minor, that I cannot take away a star for that...
customer_reviews.author: A.Ali

customer_reviews.title: Impressed!
customer_reviews.text: Came in a nice, compact box and easy to assemble without much for outside tools if I remember correctly. Was a good and more affordable solution for supporting a queen mattress on a new sleigh wood bedframe. Seemed pretty sturdy once all put together which was something I was slightly concerned about before ordering. And since being able to transport a large and bulky queen boxspring was an issue with our vehicles, this will be convenient as I believe should be able to dis-assemble and transport when we eventually move. Pretty content with purchase overall, recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Molly Rose

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: The product was to small for my standard queen sized bed and measurements on what o received weren’t correct. When I called the manufacturer she said it has been a common issue and they have received many calls about it over the last couple days but she wasn’t able to do anything about it. Thank goodness amazon is awesome! They were able to refund me and the bunkie board is going in the trash. So disappointed as we needed this to complete a bed frame.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for bulky expensive box spring
customer_reviews.text: We used this to complete a queen sized bed. We bought the headboard and footboard and rails at a yard sale and had a perfectly good mattress but no platform to support the mattress. We decided to try this and like it very much. Assembly of the item itself was very easy, and I'm impressed by how sturdy it appears to be. It is narrower than the bed rails though, so I had to put additional ledgers on the rails in order to properly support the bunkie board.
customer_reviews.author: Utah Pete

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t recommend unless you have zinus bed frame already
customer_reviews.text: This was very easy to assemble which was a plus, BUT the size did not fit my queen bed. I measured multiple times in hopes it would be right, but as many reviewers mentioned it was about an inch too short. I do not have a zinus bedframe so perhaps that’s where I made my mistake. Instead of worrying about returning this gigantic thing, I just put a few of the original flimsy wood bunky boards back on for this to sit upon and so far this item is working. It does slide a bit, but not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: RinB

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution to lower a TALL bed.
customer_reviews.text: I have a senior Great Dane who has started having trouble getting into my VERY tall bed (super thick mattress with a regular box spring). This was the perfect solution to eliminate the box spring and lower the bed to a reasonable height. Easy to assemble. Much easier to move than the box spring that I removed. Seems exceptionally sturdy. Fits really well, even on my antique wooden frame bed. My only complaint about this was that two of the end pieces of the frame (long side) arrived just slightly bent. Was able to resolve with a hammer and a some muscle power, but better packaging might have prevented the issue.
customer_reviews.author: MJC

customer_reviews.title: Great Fit! No more hassle
customer_reviews.text: I live in a town home that is two stories , when I first moved in I had a hassle getting my box spring up the narrow staircase. I decided to purchase the slate when I heard it could take place of a box spring . The item arrived, and it took about 10 minutes assemble . I would buy this before a box spring any day! Its also a good gift for a student that doesn't want to move in with a huge box spring .
customer_reviews.author: Iminxs

customer_reviews.title: Alternate Purpose
customer_reviews.text: I already have a bed frame that doesn't need a box spring, however the mattress is recessed about 2 inches making it very difficult to make the bed without 2 people. I found this product while searching for a short box spring so I could raise up the mattress. This is exactly what I needed. It was very easy to assemble, came with a great ratchet tool. I placed the frame on top of my platform slats and it was perfect. I ordered the queen and can see why the other reviews say it's a little small for its actual purpose, however I am using for an alternate purpose so it works great for me.
customer_reviews.author: Sardee

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts :(
customer_reviews.text: DISCLAIMER: A 1-star review isn’t my final one. I’ve used this product before, but on my second purchase my package arrived with missing parts. I know these mistakes happen and I’m only rating 1 Star to get the vendors attention. Had I not had this experience, I’d rate this product with 5 stars. It took me less than 20 minutes to assemble and I have it already installed in my master bedroom and it serves its purpose perfectly! Hopefully, the seller will resolve my issue of missing parts.
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: Saved my back!
customer_reviews.text: This bunkie board worked like it had promised。Easy to install and it's sturdy. It does not flex like a wooden board, so it doesn't sink. I have a queen bed and the only problem was that it run small (some people say it's too big). Therefore I can't throw away my original wooden board, I need that to hold the metal bunkie board. Also, the instruction was a little confusing. It looks like I need another bar across the board, but I couldn't find that extra piece.
customer_reviews.author: H. SV

customer_reviews.title: It fits as hoped and feels sturdy. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.text: This is replacing a 22 year old 8" box spring on a queen sleigh bed with the top of the 13" mattress nearly 30 inches off the floor. We have been searching for a lower solution but did not want a low profile box spring. My husband put it together with no problems in about 30 minutes. We had the old foundation out and this new bunkie board set in place shortly after. Now we can sit on the side of the bed with feet touching floor. Just what we had hoped for. And it feels solid within the wood bed frame.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce

customer_reviews.title: great box spring replacement for thick mattress
customer_reviews.text: I accidentally bought an upholstered bed frame that required box spring -- I thought I was getting platform.... So, I needed a mattress foundation. This had REALLY bad reviews due to not being wide enough, but I had to chance it b/c I saw nothing else similar. I found it to be a perfect size. It DOES NOT replace the wooden bed slats, but sits on top, just like a box spring would. My mattress is super high, so this was perfect b/c a regular boxspring would have made the mattress too high and ruined the look.
customer_reviews.author: Brenna Elaine Sovine

customer_reviews.title: Greatest Purchase Ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: Whoever created this needs a humanitarian award!! This is so easy to put together my 7 year old nephew could do it. I literally attached the pieces right on top of my bed frame and I was done within 15 minutes, if that. The packaging was excellent. Not a single part bent, missing, or broken. Everything you need is packed nicely inside and the instructions are easy to understand. And the best part, is that it's easy to move around. It comes in a tall box but I was able to carry it by myself. This is literally a life saver
customer_reviews.author: Riay

customer_reviews.title: Solid foundation
customer_reviews.text: This bunkie assembled quickly and easily. It is sturdy and well made. All parts were accounted for, the tool required was included, and there was even a small bag labeled "extra parts". It was a perfect fit for the metal frame I purchased with my new mattress. Unfortunately, I underestimated the rise of the metal frame, and while I was aiming for a low profile, the total height of the frame, mattress,, and bunkie did not equal what I required. I ended up returning the bunkie for that reason.
customer_reviews.author: J. Fantone

customer_reviews.title: Bars pop out if you stand it up on its side
customer_reviews.text: The bars come out and I was thinking they would lock in; I bought this so I could strap the bed to it if I needed to lean it against the wall Murphy bed style, so whenever I tried to lift it and lean it the bars would pop out and the bed would come off (plus the sticky parts of the frame would stick to the bottom of the bed and pull them out even more). Sorry if this doesn’t make sense. If you need it for a regular frame maybe it’s okay but it did not work for me. I also don’t know how supportive it is because my bed rests on the floor without a box spring.
customer_reviews.author: NA

customer_reviews.title: Garabge-screw insert stripped
customer_reviews.text: This frame concept is good but the qc is poor. The screw insert to hold the main frame in the center was stripped. Tried different screws just to be sure but, negative. Would have been nice if it was a stripped screw...easy fix. But nope, it's the actual screw insert. Amz wanted to replace entire frame, but I just needed a replacement part.was told to contact company for part. Called company, they said call amz and replace entire heavy box, take needed part and return the remaining part! HA!!
customer_reviews.author: christine

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Support
customer_reviews.text: This package was NOT delivered! I had to go and pick it up, because USPS mail lady refused to deliver it. Frustrating, but no fault of the seller who sent it a day early by the way. However, I love this bunkie board. I bought the queen Olee Sleep 18 inch Heavy Duty Mattress Foundation and bought this to add support to my memory foam mattress and this bunkie board fits the foundation perfectly. Now I no longer feel like I'm sinking. Assembly was very easy and came with everything you'll need to assemble. Even came with a free ratchet.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Jane

customer_reviews.title: Saves time and money over DIY wood slats
customer_reviews.text: Hands down, this is the easiest product that comes in 20 pieces to assemble that we've ever encountered in over 35 years of combined retail experience. The reviews that say you can assemble in it 20 minutes might be false. It's even faster. We bought this for our guest bedroom ands for our needs it's sturdy and well designed. The non-slip adhesive on 4 slats and spare parts are a nice addition to a cost effective solution to turn a metal bedframe into a platform bed.
customer_reviews.author: Anna B.

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Received yesterday. Very easy to put together and set up. Slept on it last night and it seems very sturdy. Perhaps even sturdier than the original bed slays. I can see what other reviewers mean by the dimensions. This was probably about 1 inch short of being the full width of the queen bed frame. However, I did pay attention to the measurements and luckily my platform bed frame has about a 1/2 inch lip on the interior perimeter so this frame fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: TAD

customer_reviews.title: Order a queen
customer_reviews.text: I got this because my wood slacks were breaking so I needed a back up Incase I put it up about a week ago and the first nights was okay but then I laid in it & one side went down & the other came up it was horrible I’m 9 months pregnant and it was so unstable that it made me fall on the floor I think I’ll just go back to wood I ordered a queen and it seems not to for tightly I’m guessing the reason it keeps falling in definitely won’t order another so unreliable
customer_reviews.author: Tasia Houston

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Fit the Frame right
customer_reviews.text: I want to like this and haven't slept on it yet but...it was easy to put together, about 15 minutes. But when I went to put it onto my Queen frame, it's like half an inch too short on each side. If it is supported by the rail on one side, it's missing the rail on the other. I have no idea how to correct this other than maybe put boards under it, but then that completely defeats the purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Ellisonx

customer_reviews.title: No problems to write about
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble, even came with a very handy little tool. I waited until I had the frame in place before adding the skinny rods. I don't anticipate issues with my mattress sliding on the grid because it has stickers in place for that. My ONLY issue was the frame itself slid around on the wood parts of my bed but it was an easy fix with some command strips I had laying around. They should include those also but otherwise I'm very happy I was able to get this in 2 days after Badcock sold me a "platform" bed with no additional slabs for support.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Took less than 15 minutes. However, It was smaller than expected.We ended up putting the styrofoam pieces that came in the box around the frame so it wouldn't move. I wish they would have made a little bit bigger. Its exactly the size of a queen matress so when you place on your bed it drops into place leaving lots of wiggle room. The height was perfect. It didn't come with a cover so you might want to look into an alternative for that as well. I had the 5 inch zinus previously so I just used that. It was but but it was something.
customer_reviews.author: sheena

customer_reviews.title: Great product, this is meant to reinforce NOT replace your wood slatted platform bed.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a bed through a nice furniture store, but found out the hard way that the wood platform wasn’t structurally supportive and the mattress would bow in the middle. I ended up buying this to reinforce the bed and it worked beautifully. Now, to the point of 4 stars. This frame is meant to reinforce NOT replace the wood slats in your bed and Zumiz failed to mention that in their product description. Therefore, people will find out the width is about 1” less than it should be.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Goebel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Extra Support!
customer_reviews.text: So, I bought a cheap frame and a plush memory foam mattress. This was a mix made in hades on my lower back. I purchased this for extra stability in the frame and INSTANTLY noticed the difference. I still had to buy a firm mattress topper, but with both items I’m sleeping soundly. I highly recommend if you have a flimsy bed frame!
customer_reviews.author: MzMoore777

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, the packaging is compact, easy to assemble and feels good quality, even brings the necessary tools and of course graphic instructions. The measures are 79x591⁄2 as indicated in the description, to avoid mishaps check that these measures work for you, if you cannot measure or you are not sure do not buy it; I saw reference of some buyers who complained about the measure, I imagine they did not take the forecast and in the market there are a variety of models of beds and that is important to know. If the measure fits your need, you will have a good product
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Bought this to replace box spring
customer_reviews.text: This is as described, fits for my queen size mattress perfectly. They have this sticky part so your mattress doesn't float around, the only problem is that when you change or wash your sheets, it doesn't like to let go. Very sturdy and no squeaks, it dropped right into wear my box spring was. The big plus is I can sit on my bed and reach the floor now, no having to stretch or slide off.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter4goodies

customer_reviews.title: It’s a Good Solution to my Situation
customer_reviews.text: My bed fell apart, and then my mattress was on the floor months. I didn’t think I could fix my bed by myself...but then, I started a search for bed slats - and I found this. It wasn’t that easy for me to put together by myself (but I did it!). And it doesn’t fit together perfectly. But I FIXED MY BED!! :-) It’s good enough for time being. I’m very happy. I have a heavy mattress, so I hope it holds up!
customer_reviews.author: Pearl

customer_reviews.title: We are so happy with this product.
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I are incredibly impressed with the quality of this product. We co-sleep with our daughter and have been sleeping with just a mattress and box spring on the floor. We missed the look of having our bed set up in our room, so we were able to create a platform bed with this product using our old bed. It looks fantastic. We tossed the box spring and to be honest, we may never look back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: just what I needed for my new mattress
customer_reviews.text: Bought a vegan all cotton mattress that needs to breathe. This Bunkie Board allowed me to sleep on the mattress on the floor for two weeks. Once my bed frame was assembled, this went down first, then the bed slats, then the mattress. My mattress is super heavy and having this underneath the mattress gives it the support it needs. Comes with a nifty tool that makes it quick and easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Very easy assembly and super sturdy help for slats.
customer_reviews.text: Easier than expected assembly and sturdy, this product is primarily best for beefing up existing slats. Mine were squeaking and I was worried they would crack. I suppose they would work alone but you would need to precisely measure the lip on your frame. Otherwise why leave a bad review? It's your fault! This product is definitely a life changer item. The only criticism is that a non slip aid is needed on bottom meeting slats.
customer_reviews.author: brewster lewster

customer_reviews.title: Squeaks
customer_reviews.text: For those not having squeaking issues, I envy you. I put everything together to a T and have room for it on my queen bed frame, but it does make a loud sound after prolonged use. I got this specifically for reduced noise and a sturdier support. In some ways the noise is reduced, and the support certainly is better, but it still squeaks. Disappointing but it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Roane

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to go with the queen size bed frame from the same company. Built it in less than 30 minutes. Frame is stable and provides plenty of support for a gel top mattress. There is a little extra space between the frame and the bed frame as other reviews state, but pulled the frame all the way to the bottom takes care of it. Would buy again
customer_reviews.author: StarWarsNut

customer_reviews.title: Ease of assembling
customer_reviews.text: It’s durable and easy to install. Make sure before you buy this you have made measurements to your existing bed frame where this product will sit to hold your mattress. Look for possible gaps in between the bed and this. I had to put a piece of wood in between gaps but it works perfect. Not all existing bed frames are same even if it says Twin/Queen/King. I still recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly, sturdy enough... shipping issues.
customer_reviews.text: Took two attempts to deliver via USPS... for whatever reason, same carrier was selected after they lost the item the first time around. Second delivery was fast and impressive; being on a Sunday (didn't know USPS worked on Sundays). Unfortunately, second delivery arrived with a damaged box... can't say for sure whether it was damaged in transit or by building's receiving folks. Assembly was easy; great tools included. Feels sturdy enough by itself. We are using this under a thick bedroom memory foam mattress because we want to keep it low profile for a toddler to get in and out. Wish it had some sort of optional padding on its sides to hold it in place more firmly where needed.
customer_reviews.author: Pete T.

customer_reviews.title: Happiness!!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a 74 year old woman and couldn’t affor a new box spring - saw this - ordered it - I put it together myself in 30 minutes - wish handling the mattress would had been as easy - it is perfect - best nights sleep I’ve had in a long time - would never go back to traditional box spring - I’m telling everyone - PS: I ordered this because I purchased a free standing wooden slatted mattress fram for my guest room - Which I also love -
customer_reviews.author: s sanford

customer_reviews.title: Works great, BUT.....
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE my bed now!!!! The boards that came with it were cheap and made a noise every time I moved. I have to agree with some of the other reviewers about it not fitting the way that it should. It was slightly shorter than it should have been. But had the frame seat in the middle, and added 4 boards (I forgot the length, and thickness) to the corners, and it worked out perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Renee' Davila

customer_reviews.title: Good? Yes. Perfect Fit? Maybe.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Sturdy. Noiseless. Affordable. Cons: The square part of the bar was bent so I had to bend it back into shape (glad my dad has tools) or else the other piece won't slide in. I bought this in Queen, but it was a bit too small for my bed frame. It would literally just fall through. So I just set it ontop of my old wooden bunkie board (still works fine, I just have some broken wooden slats). I really wish this bunkie board came with platform legs, bc we never know if it'll fit every queen size bed.
customer_reviews.author: Hnou Lee

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased!
customer_reviews.text: We are passionate about having our mattress on the floor, but we had, unfortunately, noticed that we were getting mildew on the bottom of our mattress. So we wanted something to give just the tiniest bit of airspace. This was super easy to put together (everything was numbered and well-organized), and included a really nice little ratchet for tightening everything up, as well as two spare screws. So far, we have not noticed any squeaking and it is very comfortable. Very glad we found this!
customer_reviews.author: WhenInRome

customer_reviews.title: Probably good, but not if you have a Zinus bed
customer_reviews.text: While it may be a good choice, if you are buying this for a Zinus bed it is useless. I have two Zinus beds with slats. The regular bed is fine, but the low rise always has the slats moving downward. I ordered this Zinus product assuming it would match a Zinus bed, which sadly is not and is useless.
customer_reviews.author: Riggs152

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace my box spring for my bed. Easy as pie to assemble. Very sturdy, Not squeaky (I was a little worried). I did have to buy some foam for cushion. My bed frame is metal as well, and the frame and the Zinus would clack together easy. But I bought some door insulation strips to put on my bed frame, and now the bed is perfect. No clacking. Great support. Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Too small for Queen Ikea Malm bed
customer_reviews.text: Looks like a good product, unfortunately the queen sized product was too small for my Ikea queen-sized Malm bed. It kept falling down even though the Ikea inside silver frame was in place on the sides.
customer_reviews.author: spryness

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy construction... allows for mattress support without box spring.
customer_reviews.text: Decided to go with Zinus “metal” frame vs wooden bunkie boards. VERY sturdy construction, instructions were clear and easy to follow. Completed “the build” in less than 10 minutes and installed mattress. Size was as labeled (e.g. queen size bed fit within the existing bed frame.). Enabled removal of box spring, which lowered the mattress height by at least 6 inches. Guests no longer have to take a running start to jump up onto the bed.
customer_reviews.author: Gambit0959

customer_reviews.title: Fast Shipping, but doesn't Fit!
customer_reviews.text: Well, first of all, the package came really fast. I opted for free shipping, and expected to be waiting, but it came in two days. However, that's where the good news ends. Assembling it was easy enough I suppose, but once done it didn't fit my bedframe. It was maybe half an inch too small, therefore, useless. I'm assuming they measured it based on mattress size, not bedframe, which is slightly wider than mattress. They should really fix this.
customer_reviews.author: S. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Better then 5 starts
customer_reviews.text: I have never assembled anything as easy as this before. The quality of the metal, do yourself a favor and just skip the wood platform. You'll have a much better over experience not only assembling but simply well designed. I also like the two sided tape on 4 of the platforms to "hold" your mattress into place. I never really thought it was important until now realizing my mattress isn't moving anymore. GREAT PRODUCT and a GREAT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: anon

customer_reviews.title: Easy and fast!!!
customer_reviews.text: Got this today and wasted no time in putting it together! Our bed came with 4 wooden slats with leg attachment but after a few moving the bed around and kids jumping on the bed, they wore down and broke. We tried making more slats but they move around and was waking up with back pains. The parts were a bit Smaller but we stuck the foam it in and it fits pretty sturdy and firm! We love it!! We can already feel the difference!
customer_reviews.author: Sophearktra hon

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This product was extremely well packaged. Everything was well wrapped, even the packing materials were wrapped so that they wouldn't make a mess. It came with a small ratchet wrench for easy assembly. This product is easy to put together, with clear instructions. It fits our new IKEA bed perfectly there is a little extra space, about 1/2 an inch which we packed with a piece of cardboard to stop any movement. I would recommend this bunkie bed to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Jones

customer_reviews.title: Seems to serve its purpose so far
customer_reviews.text: The bunkee board was extremely easy to put together, I did it myself. Like other reviewers have stated, it does not fit a regular sized queen bed frame, however, it appears to do the trick and provide the support that I need, though I have it resting on top of the 3 metal support slats that originally came with my bed when I purchased it years ago. Only time will tell how it holds up, but so far I’m satisfied. One thing to note: it will bring your mattress and box spring higher ( if you use both like I do).
customer_reviews.author: RT(R)

customer_reviews.title: Did the job!
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly as promised. Easy to assemble with clear, large instructions. Did the job well—to support our Caspar foam mattress on a basic metal bed frame instead of a box springs. The sizing is pretty close, with an 1 1/2 or so total gap to the edge of the outside rails of the bed frame. This worked fine for use with the metal bed frame we had but wouldn’t be appropriate if the bed frame had absolutely no middle support
customer_reviews.author: Chaing Jaime

customer_reviews.title: Great!!
customer_reviews.text: Replaced queen box-springs which made the bed extra-high which it was supposed to do. But, I could not climb (literally) onto the bed without a stool. I am too old to have to climb into bed at all. This bed slat replacement brought the mattress down 9 inches which made both me and my pup very happy!! No more climbing! Easy to put together! Much better than wood slats which we had already used on another bed and less expensive!
customer_reviews.author: Fernetta

customer_reviews.title: Setup is a breeze.  A breeze.
customer_reviews.text: This product is awesome, including reasonable cost. We thought it would take forever to assemble like some Swedish furniture. It was a breeze. Everything was well-labeled, the instructions were simple and clear. The best part is that it feels very sturdy. Bonus! They give you spare parts (that are labeled as such) and a useful-beyond-setup mini ratchet that’s surprisingly well-made. This is for a guest bed, so it may be awhile until we know how it performs, but I’m pretty confident there will not be any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley S

customer_reviews.title: Noisy
customer_reviews.text: we moved to a new house our queen box spring wouldn’t fit through the stair case so we had to find a solution and this was it for a couple of months. It works just fine except it’s super noisy even if you just sit on the bed or are flipping sides. It served it’s purpose but just order a split box spring and I’m not longer will be using this.
customer_reviews.author: Caperst

customer_reviews.title: A really great product
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazingly well thought out and executed item. All parts are clearly labeled, making the assembly a snap. The bolts are pre assembled with washers, and they even include a couple extras. They also include a mini ratchet!! The unit is very sturdy and carefully finished. I would give this more than five stars if that were an option.
customer_reviews.author: Caddis

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly, solid, but too short
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was easy, just like my king size wood slat Zinus board, but this queen is an inch shorter than it should be. Replaced a perfectly fitting queen box spring on a queen bedfram with this, that moves side to side. Had to add 3M rubber furniture floor protector feet to the frame (bottom and side) to make up the gap and stop from sliding.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly, quality product.
customer_reviews.text: This product is quality. Even comes with a ratchet to make assembly even easier. Not difficult assembly. Mine did come USPS so I had to go to the post office to pick up the 6’ or so long box. It did fit into my small SUV.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine

customer_reviews.title: THUMBS UP👍👍; If your frames width can be adjusted..
customer_reviews.text: This product is well designed. Simple and effective. The instructions are easy to follow. They even supply you with the tools including a small ratchet. Not to mention a couple extra screws. I thought that was a touch of class. I want to mention that some reviews complained the width was 1 to 2 inches too narrow. Which will be a problem. This was true but some steel bed frames can be adjusted. If yours can't be adjusted then you might not be leaving such a favorable review. My frame is adjustable.. so this product worked out fine for me..
customer_reviews.author: Craig Kaneshiro

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase ever
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best purchases I have ever made. My husband and I bought a brand new bed frame a year ago and the wooden slats it came with have started creaking so badly it would wake both of us up all night with any slight movement. I read another review of someone who bought this to put over their wood slats and it truly did help! There is no longer any sound at all when we are in bed. 10000% recommend this!!
customer_reviews.author: Erin Bouteiller

customer_reviews.title: Replaced box springs
customer_reviews.text: This is the second bunkie board I purchased. This purchase was for my nephew who was sleeping on a horrible mattress and a box spring with a giant hole. We were visiting at luckily I was pushy enough to look at his room/bed and noticed this broken bed. We immediately purchased a new mattress and ordered the bunkie board from Amazon. It arrived 2 days later and he's been sleeping great every since. Perfect solution!
customer_reviews.author: blkdogs2

customer_reviews.title: Great product!  Not just for memory foam mattresses
customer_reviews.text: This product really helped my bed. I bought it to use as the slats on a sleigh bed. Previously, I just used a simple metal bed frame from the mattress store. My mattress sagged on each side and peaked in the middle, which I assumed was the mattress. After putting my Beautyrest mattress and box spring on this bunkie board, my mattress doesn't sag anymore! Great product! Very solid, well-made and super easy to put together.
customer_reviews.author: B. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great solution. Super easy assembly
customer_reviews.text: Shown my dads solution. Duct taping the broken boards. I thought yeah...no. This was a great solution. My son and his friend decided to wrestle on the bed and broke it. Well this was a great solution I just took apart the old slut system and put this in its place. I just had Surgery so I literally put this together with one hand
customer_reviews.author: Melissa P

customer_reviews.title: It was easy for my husband and I to put together and ...
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what we wanted for our new bedroom set. It was easy for my husband and I to put together and is much stronger and better quality compared to the other flimsy bunky boards I've seen. The only negative is now our mattress slides around on the frame, but that is something we can easily remedy
customer_reviews.author: Jess H.

customer_reviews.title: You won't ever use bulky boxsprings again
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome product. I recently got a new mattress and bed frame and the bed was altogether too tall with my old 11" boxsprings. The BunkieBoard was easy to put together and is extremely sturdy. It fit well on the bed frame and the non-slip tape keeps the mattress from sliding. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt V Pollack

customer_reviews.title: Beautifully packaged and fast, easy assembly
customer_reviews.text: Five stars: easy to unpack, parts and tools easy to find and use, excellent instructions. Necessary hand tools: Choice of ratchet tool and Allen wrench for inserting bolts, which was helpful to our household, where one of us is adept at using the ratchet tool and the the other is more comfortable with the Allen wrench. It took about half hour to put together. Finished product is attractive. We installed it on top of wooden slats to slightly raise the mattress above the side rails so we could make the bed without scraping our knuckles.
customer_reviews.author: little old lady

customer_reviews.title: One of the best quality products I have received from Amazon
customer_reviews.text: This frame was a replacement for the wooden frame that broke. This was one of the product experiences I have had, right from minimal packaging to clear instructions to the assembly. The quality is one of the best I have seen. The dimensions are exactly as stated on the product description. Measure your bed frame size before ordering and enjoy a product that will last you a lifetime. Thank you Zinus team to paying attention to every detail of customer experience, and delivering a product that has great quality and value.
customer_reviews.author: V D

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Assemble, Works Great
customer_reviews.text: We put this together in just a few minutes. Easy peasy. And it does a great job, making our somewhat too soft-feeling new Serta hybrid matress feel more firm and less likely to "slip through" our frame. We placed this item on top of our old and somewhat bowed birch slats, and the strength of the metal and excellent construction make us feel secure in our sleep. No sag or drag.
customer_reviews.author: CoMtWoman

customer_reviews.title: Easy and does the job
customer_reviews.text: So easy to put together and the instructions really spell it out for you. I have a metal bed frame that came with my bed so the frame is meant to work with a box spring. I was looking to get rid of my box spring so I got this. Wanted something that did the job without buying an expensive bed frame. This fit perfectly! Simple and seems sturdy so far.
customer_reviews.author: Legit Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Great slats
customer_reviews.text: Great performance and solution to box spring. I decided to get the queen slats to use on my standard adjustable bed frame. It was easy to set up and fit perfectly into the frame. The product came well packaged, and with clear easy to follow instrucrions. Assembly was easy. I used zip ties to secure the frame to the slats Very sturdy, quiet. Better than buyimg a whole new queen size bed frame.
customer_reviews.author: Peach

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: We have been using the Zinus boxspringn for about an year now and it is so good and that's why we chose zinus product for the foundation. > Super easy to assemble ( once out of the box less than 30 min) > Sturdy > Enough supports so that there is absolutely no sagging and works perfect. >Better than wooden slats in aspect of assembly, installing and money. Highly recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: Maya Devan

customer_reviews.title: It works, solved my broken slat problem
customer_reviews.text: I’m so happy with this! My wooden slats broke and I’ve been sleeping lopsided for months. I bought this instead of getting the wood fixed and it was definitely worth it. It’s not too small, holds my mattress, and was pretty easy for me and my boyfriend to put together. I still left the wooden slats under for extra support (not all of them are broken) thanks zinus!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Alovis

customer_reviews.title: No more sagging mattress!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a bed that came with only 5 wooden slats. but my mattress was 14" and very heavy and was sinking through the gaps. Well this straigened my sloping mattress right up. It is heavy metal, and solid, more sturdy than wood. The assemble was fairly easy too.
customer_reviews.author: Florida Real Estate Pro

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: This does exactly what I needed it to. We bought a secondhand bed frame, but it was WAY too high with both the mattress and box spring. With this, it's much easier to actually get into bed! This stays put in the frame, is quite sturdy, and was easy to assemble. I do wish that the rails locked into place better. We did take off the adhesive as recommended, and when I change the sheets it makes it much more difficult, also pulling the rails out as well. Not a big deal, just a bit of a pain. Overall, we really like it!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Strong and Easy Assembly
customer_reviews.text: I first got one of these for a used king-sized bed purchased at a thrift store and instead of having to construct a mattress support out of wood to replace the missing wood one, I used this instead. I am now in the process of replacing the support for a queen-sized mattress. This was very easy to assemble and very strong (supporting a 350 pound king mattress). The queen-sized mattress is much lighter so no problem there. This saved me a bunch of time and effort.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin

customer_reviews.title: No fit
customer_reviews.text: This frame fell right through the frame of my queen size bed. I think it would have been great if it had fit. Not sure what kind of queen-sized bed it is designed for. I am trying a new system with adjustable pieces that fit from a double to a king bed.
customer_reviews.author: Rosalie Ruegg

customer_reviews.title: Work for my bed frame W 60x L 80
customer_reviews.text: It has only a 1/4" gap from left and right side. I put the frame and mattress all the way touch to head board because I need comforter space between foot board and mattress. It is just fine for my bed.
customer_reviews.author: rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Better Alternative to Wood
customer_reviews.text: By far the best replacement slats available. These are metal and much stronger than wood. Two man job but very easy to assemble. It basically snaps together. Saved my beautiful Sleigh Bed. Also very affordable compared to wooden slats. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: So far so good !!
customer_reviews.text: Assembled in like 20 minutes, very sturdy. I bought a cheap bed frame with wood slats that were very thin. Within a week I had to pull my mattress a certain way to avoid falling through in the middle of the night. And my back was always killing me. This metal frame fit perfectly and provides excellent firm support. It solved all my problems. I assembled it in the middle of the night very fast. Thank you so much.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Best thing I’ve ever had to put together.
customer_reviews.text: This is heavy and solid! It was also the easiest thing I have ever had to put together in my life. Not only did it come with an Allen wrench, but it also came with a mini Allen ratchet. Took less than ten minutes to unpack and put together. Everything was wrapped nicely. Perfect item.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon G

customer_reviews.title: This was like an inch too short
customer_reviews.text: My hubby and I bought this for our queen bed because the wooden boards kept sliding and breaking. This was like an inch too short. Just because we didn't want to put in the effort of returning or reselling it we kind of made it work. We positioned it as best we could and added some boards on one side to make up for the inch it needs. It's been a month and we haven't had an incidents, but I would have felt more satisfied if it was already the perfect size without playing with it.
customer_reviews.author: scarlet

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: The instructions were simple and even came with the tool needed to assemble. Once assembled it fit perfectly in my queen bed frame. I hoped on the mattress and wiggled to see if it was noisy and it passed that test to. I’m very satisfied with this alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Kalia Miller
